title: carol97
author: carol97
content: I'm planning to host a few miners in the coming weeks and was wondering which locations have the most famous mining facilities in the world. Could someone please let me know?

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: I think this depends on what continent you're on. If it's America, Canada and Venezuela probably have the cheapest oil. If it's Europe the hotspot of mining is often Belgium but there might be other places where cheap electricity can be negotiated. Asia and the Middle East will be easy to find based on where units moved after the China mining ban (iirc kygrystan and kazakhstan).I'm not sure whether mining plants get cheap electricity from the grid or produce their own and need their own generators and resources (such as from renewables - especially in places where it's possible to claim tax credits for being greener).

comments.body: Canada, the United States, Iceland, Georgia, and Switzerland have some of the largest Bitcoin mining facilities. Visit https://www.zionodes.com/blog/mining-facilities-landscape-overview to learn more about why these locations are so popular.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on December 16, 2022, 07:58:15 PMBest miners to mince Bitcoin with renewable energy sources like water energy z solar energy and other such energy that can be generated free.I would not call them free energy. Especially if OP needs to set it up on his own. It might be even more expensive compared to a traditional electricity source, at least in the beginning. At the end of the day, what matters the most is profit and how long it takes to break even so you can start earning money from mining, so if OP can only get power from the grid but it is cheap enough then it is fine to do so. Also, be careful of those hosted mining services. Some of them have unclear backgrounds and even if they have photos of their mining site, they might be fake. I've seen many scams centered around this kind of service where at the end of the day they stop the business without giving any meaningful ROI to its users.OP, other than electricity cost, you might want to also look for their stance on Bitcoin, taxes, mining regulation, and so on in general. Some country has detailed regulation for mining while others don't. As far as I know, your earnings might be affected by this, especially if you need to do taxes. CMIIW.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: carol97 on December 07, 2022, 11:12:50 AMI'm planning to host a few miners in the coming weeks and was wondering which locations have the most famous mining facilities in the world. Could someone please let me know?If you mean physically located mining companies, then they are located in different regions and continents, for example Hut 8 Mining Corp is located in Canada and has three mining centers, two of them are located in Alberta, and one in Ontario. Cipher Mining Inc is based in New York, but also has data centers in Ukraine, for example, Canaan Inc in China, Marathon Digital Holdings, Inc in Nevada, of course there are smaller ones. If you mean cloud mining, then it is better not to consider it at all, since this is a common ponzi scheme.

comments.author: Patrol69
comments.body: As you might be aware that Bitcoin mining requires a lot of electricity. Along with electricity, you will need various machinery to mine your bitcoins. Many Bitcoin miners have confirmed that the amount of electricity they use to mine Bitcoin does not make their mining profitable with electricity bills. So you must think about these things before making up your mind.

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: Quote from: carol97 on December 07, 2022, 11:12:50 AMI'm planning to host a few miners in the coming weeks and was wondering which locations have the most famous mining facilities in the world. Could someone please let me know?Countries with significant Bitcoin mining operations include the United States, Canada, and Russia.The United States is home to several large Bitcoin mining facilities, with operations in states such as Washington, Montana, and Texas. Canada has a relatively low energy cost, cool climate and abundant natural resources. The country is home to some of the world's largest mining facilities, with operations in provinces such as Quebec and British Columbia. Russia has a large amount of excess energy capacity. Some of the largest mining facilities in Russia are located in Siberia, where electricity costs are relatively low.  Iceland has a cold climate, abundant renewable energy resources and cheap electricity. Some of the largest mining facilities in Iceland are located in Reykjavik, the capital city.Depending on your demand and what you are looking for, you can choose one from above.
